definitions.definition: look at all parts of (something) carefully in order to detect some feature.
examples: he raised his binoculars to scan the coast

definitions.definition: look quickly but not very thoroughly through (a document or other text) in order to identify relevant information.
examples: we scan the papers for news from the trouble spots
synonyms: browse (through) "I scanned the pages of his diary"

definitions.definition: cause (a surface, object, or part of the body) to be traversed by a detector or an electromagnetic beam.
examples: their brains are scanned so that researchers can monitor the progress of the disease

definitions.definition: cause (a beam) to traverse across a surface or object.
examples: we scanned the beam over a sector of 120Â°

definitions.definition: convert (a document or picture) into digital form for storage or processing on a computer.
examples: text and pictures can be scanned into the computer

definitions.definition: resolve (a picture) into its elements of light and shade in a prearranged pattern for the purposes of television transmission.
analyze the meter of (a line of verse) by reading with the emphasis on its rhythm or by examining the pattern of feet or syllables.
an act of scanning someone or something.
examples: a quick scan of the sports page
synonyms: survey More"a careful scan of the terrain"glance
skim "a quick scan through the report"

definitions.definition: a medical examination using a scanner.
an image obtained by scanning or with a scanner.
examples: we can't predict anything until we have seen the scan
